channel.title: ProxySQL Monitoring on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in ProxySQL Monitoring on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Monitor ProxySQL using Builtin Prometheus Discovery
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring ProxySQL with builtin Prometheus This tutorial will show you how to monitor ProxySQL using builtin Prometheus scraper. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using kind. Install KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.

item.title: Monitor ProxySQL using Prometheus Operator
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring ProxySQL Using CoreOS Prometheus Operator CoreOS prometheus-operator provides simple and Kubernetes native ways to deploy and configure the Prometheus server. This tutorial will show you how to use the CoreOS Prometheus operator to monitor ProxySQL deployed with KubeDB. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
